excerpts: Other goodies: bbq chicken (it's part of the daily lunch special), tom kah (doesn't look like other places', but it's still yummy), panang curry (duh), pad thai (isn't too sweet like a lot of places nowadays)... and so much more.
panang curry.author: sina t.
panang curry.review:
I eat here a lot. A LOT. seriously. Twice in the past three days, and they were closed yesterday. (Closed on Sundays, take note)... My boyfriend and I love Thai food. And Lanna is a staple in our lives. But it still took a Yelp review (KayJay's) to get me to try the Rama Thai. WOW! When I read the review, it got me in the mood for peanut sauce, but it was Sunday so I went to some other Thai place nearby and had their peanut sauce chicken. It was fine. Today, I wound up going to Lanna, because I'm lazy like that. Ordered the Rama. Having the ability to compare it to yesterday's inferior peanut sauce made it even better! I recommend you go somewhere else that you think is good, then come here. You'll be impressed, I promise.

Other goodies: bbq chicken (it's part of the daily lunch special), tom kah (doesn't look like other places', but it's still yummy), panang curry (duh), pad thai (isn't too sweet like a lot of places nowadays)... and so much more.

The service is always the same reliable guy who always recognizes you, or tries to, and never really remembers you. I like him. He's smiley and polite. He always asks me at the end of the meal if I want dessert and it's become a joke because I never save room, being the pig I am.

There're about a dozen tables. I've never seen it full, which is a shame. I want them to have great business so they'll always be there when I need them.

excerpts: Ordered the green curry and red curry by the way.
green curry.author: Anna B.
green curry.review:
I really liked this place! Looks nice and presentable inside, great customer service and food was very good! Ordered the green curry and red curry by the way.

 Will definitely come back!

excerpts: Green curry tasted good, the satay was on point, and the complimentary soup was good.
And the hot fried banana dessert that came with dinner for an extra $3 was more than worth it.
green curry.author: Jack R.
green curry.review:
$10.00 dinner specials an great service, what's not to like about that?

The food was good too, not overly great, but for the price it was well worth it.

Green curry tasted good, the satay was on point, and the complimentary soup was good. And the hot fried banana dessert that came with dinner for an extra $3 was more than worth it. It was an up charge of $3 for dessert, tea, and the satay which was worth it.

The owner was super friendly, and I would definitely return again.

excerpts: We had the green curry, pineapple curry, and the coconut soup.
All delicious!
green curry.author: Becky G.
green curry.review: My boyfriend and I came for dinner. Very reasonably priced food and wine for $4 a glass! Amazing. The staff were very gracious and helpful. A great place to find vegan and vegetarian food. We had the green curry, pineapple curry, and the coconut soup. All delicious!

excerpts: We had Tom Yum soup and Tofu green curry.
green curry.author: Victoria M.
green curry.review:
We are new to San Francisco and wanted to try out a Thai restaurant near by so we decided on Lanna Thai. I am glad we did! We had Tom Yum soup and Tofu green curry. Both were excellent!

I also really liked the small and cozy feel of the restaurant itself. It's perfect to relax and enjoy tasty food, cold beer, and good conversation.

excerpts: My friend and I then shared orders of the Rama Tofu and Green Curry Veggies.
The Rama Tofu is a peanut-curry dish that comes on a bed of steamed spinach - almost had a flavor of a Japanese Gomae.
We both felt that there was maybe too much sweetness/sugar though.
Would like to see it with the sweetness toned way down, because the dish has great potential - I'd even see if I could order it less sweet, and maybe do some hot sauce with it.
The green curry we ordered with just veggies and it was full of them all
cooked to perfection.
I ordered it hot, which was maybe one degree too much for my friend, but I didn't even have to ask for water
so I had no issues with it.
green curry.author: Emily C.
green curry.review:
Very tasty and fresh. We came here for late lunch/early dinner while our car was getting serviced a few blocks down at  Sunset Service. The Tom Kha and Tom Yum soups were both fantastic, we each got a cup and traded back and forth. The soups deserve 5 stars alone.

We then got the veggie tofu version of the ground rice salad like Larb which was also really good. They use lettuce with it here; I have had it other places with cabbage which maybe is a little more of an acquired taste, but still this was very very good. 

My friend and I then shared orders of the Rama Tofu and Green Curry Veggies. The Rama Tofu is a peanut-curry dish that comes on a bed of steamed spinach - almost had a flavor of a Japanese Gomae. We both felt that there was maybe too much sweetness/sugar though. Would like to see it with the sweetness toned way down, because the dish has great potential - I'd even see if I could order it less sweet, and maybe do some hot sauce with it. The flavor and consistency of the fried tofu in it was excellent, as was the spinach, which is why I might see if the sweet level could be modified.

The green curry we ordered with just veggies and it was full of them all cooked to perfection. I ordered it hot, which was maybe one degree too much for my friend, but I didn't even have to ask for water so I had no issues with it. It was great.

Complete dinner including a Thai Iced Tea for my friend and my diet drink was under $35 including the tip.

I will go back, for sure.

excerpts: The vegetarian Pad See Yoo and the green curry are a definite must.
Filled with fresh veggies.
The green curry is spice and they can't make it mild for some reason.
The coconut soup is super good for one of those cold nights.
green curry.author: Katie Anne N.
green curry.review:
Wow, this place is good. The decor looks like the inside of a 1970's single family home. It is cute and quaint. The food is excellent. The vegetarian Pad See Yoo and the green curry are a definite must. Filled with fresh veggies. The green curry is spice and they can't make it mild for some reason. The coconut soup is super good for one of those cold nights. Medium fills 2 tummies. 

Great Thai place for the Sunset District. Parking can be tough but is do-able with patience.

excerpts: if ordering, stay away from the pad see ew and the green curry
it looked like they reheated someone else's leftover box they forgot to take after their meal.
ugh!
green curry.author: curi k.
green curry.review:
wow this place was insanely not that good.  where the spices yo!

what is the sunset smoking or maybe lanna was having a bad night cuz clearly the vegetables on my dish came from the frozen food isle, possibly the canned isle. 

if ordering, stay away from the pad see ew and the green curry it looked like they reheated someone else's leftover box they forgot to take after their meal. ugh! but i kept chugging into my mouth cuz im asian and need to eat everything on my plate.

good luck guys. sorry for the bad review, i know you cherish your yelp reviews but it had to have been said.

excerpts:
Nothing special and the soup water tastes funny4/10 

Fish cake 6 small ass pieces cut in half with sweet dipping sauce 7/10.
fish cake.author: Dan M.
fish cake.review:
Microwave beeping in the kitchen. Beep beep beep red flags 
One of the worst Thai food I have ever tasted.
Lacked flavor , authenticity , skill.

Local mom and pop shop. Nice decor and good service. Guy takes orders lady cooks in the back. Since 1988 but place was empty when I arrived and how you manage to stay open for so long with the type of product you provide 

some house soup cabbage msg water. 
Nothing special and the soup water tastes funny4/10 

Fish cake 6 small ass pieces cut in half with sweet dipping sauce 7/10. Had some ok flavor but the portion is way to skimp.

Pad thai worst I have ever had in the city. Skimp portion meat and tofu looked so skimp. 3/10
Hollywood Thai pad Thai where are you in SF? 

I had high hopes but when you tried good Thai food in LA this place can't compare/compete. Save yourself the trouble and money and stay away from the food here. 
Overall the food sucks! The service is good but who goes for service unless you want to :)

excerpts:
we ordered an extra cup since there were 3 of us)
Fish Cake Appetizer
Yellow Curry with Chicken
Garlic Pork
Steamed rice
- Sauteed veggies with tofu (don't remember the name, it wasn't very memorable)
fish cake.author: Jenna H.
fish cake.review:
~3.5 Stars~

While the food was tasty and delicious, their portions were a bit lacking. I didn't know if it was because we walked in 30 minutes before closing, but it seems from other reviews that we were not the only ones who felt this way. (I felt bad right before closing--but we spent all day moving into a place a couple blocks away so we were hungry and it was the only open closeby option)

WE ORDERED:
- $30 dinner for 2 set which included:
Tom Yum Soup (2 cups -- we ordered an extra cup since there were 3 of us)
Fish Cake Appetizer
Yellow Curry with Chicken
Garlic Pork
Steamed rice
- Sauteed veggies with tofu (don't remember the name, it wasn't very memorable)

THE GOOD: 
+ Everything was tasty
+ The Soup wasn't overly sour and I really enjoyed this
+ The Curry flavor was very good
+ I like the mom&pop service atmosphere
+ Very friendly and fast to refill water

THE BAD:
- Small portions and therefore not worth the price
- Slow service getting food out (even though we were the ONLY people in the place)
- Thai curry is made with coconut milk which gives it a thinner consistency than Chinese/Japanese Curry. I found it very odd that they served this on a plate instead of in a bowl, so it just spread out over the entire plate which made the amount of chicken seem very sparse and made it more difficult to spoon it onto the rice (very tasty though!).

excerpts: I ordered Chicken Satay.
No peanuts in sauce, tastes sweet and pre-made.
Chicken tasted bad, like it was microwaved.
No Thai tea with out cream and sugar.
Pre made.
chicken satay.author: Mario A.
chicken satay.review:
Walking around and walk in here. Clean, friendly waiter but... Food is , ok. No where near the quality of Marnies and on the lower end of Thai food. 

I ordered Chicken Satay. No peanuts in sauce, tastes sweet and pre-made. Chicken tasted bad, like it was microwaved. No Thai tea with out cream and sugar. Pre made. Food looked nothing like the picture. 

Not good for San Francisco. This pace belongs in the Burbs. Disappointed.

excerpts: The $6.25 order of Chicken Satay came with a couple of skewers marinated in curry paste and accompanied by the all-critical peanut sauce with a nice consistency (see photo).
Entrees were solid.
chicken satay.author: Ed U.
chicken satay.review:
Lanna is not a place I would have found on my own. San Francisco is not one city but a cluster of culinary micro-climates like the heavily Asian fog bank that makes up this stretch of Noriega in the Outer Sunset. My massage therapist (yes, I have one...sometimes...don't judge me!) recommended it to me a while ago, and he looks like a very healthy eater with a penchant for spicy Southeast Asian by way of his Malaysian-bred wife. So I convinced Jamie W. to make the trek with me to try it on an evening where we felt the need to try something healthy. We didn't accomplish "healthy", but we managed to have some surprisingly good eats for the drive. 

We started with a hearty $6.95 bowl of Tohm Kah, the coconut milk soup with chicken, mushroom, baby corns, green onion, lemongrass and lemon juice (see photo). Perfect starter on a cold night. The $6.25 order of Chicken Satay came with a couple of skewers marinated in curry paste and accompanied by the all-critical peanut sauce with a nice consistency (see photo). Entrees were solid. We went even more predictable with the $7.25 Pad Kee Mao, which offered the thick chow fun noodles mixed with chicken, broccoli and bok choy (see photo). 

Jamie went back to his Kentucky roots when he was drawn to the $8.50 Barbecue Chicken, which came with four big pieces slathered with a sweet curry sauce that wasn't too overwhelming (see photo). It didn't seem like a particularly Thai dish but who cares. We should have been sated, but we decided to try the desserts since we made room. The $2.75 Flan was delicious enough, but the standout was the $3.75 Fried Banana with Coconut Ice Cream. Fried with a crunchy crust and a nice contrast to the bracing coconut flavor of the ice cream (see photos). Definitely worth a trip out to the far reaches of the Sunset for us downtown types. 

FOOD - 4 stars...excellent Thai dishes, well priced 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...compact place, could do without the lotto boards 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...good though attention wavers when big parties come in 
TOTAL - 4 stars...barbecue chicken and fried bananas almost give this Thai place a country twang

excerpts: Other dishes we ordered: The Pad Thai and the Beef w/ spinach were probably the best out of everything we tried; Panang Beef (okay); Yellow Curry (okay); And Chicken Satay (super dry)
chicken satay.author: jesiree b.
chicken satay.review:
Since we were in the area, my family and I decided to try this spot for dinner. The staff was very attentive, which is probably the only thing that was memorable. I'm saying this because every dish we had was just OKAY...not bad, but just okay.  Our entrees didn't really look too presentable and there was just way more sauce on the dish than there was meat or vegetables - we didn't have enough to share amongst 6 ppl. 

I made sure to order the peanut sauce (which we had with tofu as an appetizer) since it was one of the highlights of Lanna on Yelp. They even sell their sauce for $5 a jar!  When I finally got to taste it, I was pretty disappointed because it tasted like they just melted spoonfuls of Skippy.

Other dishes we ordered: The Pad Thai and the Beef w/ spinach were probably the best out of everything we tried; Panang Beef (okay); Yellow Curry (okay); And Chicken Satay (super dry)

excerpts: The chicken satay tastes like yellow curry and peanut sauce and the fried stuffed chicken was really weird.
My boyfriend wouldn't even eat it after the first bite.
The soup and the beginning was weird too.
chicken satay.author: Melinda M.
chicken satay.review:
Meh.
It has potential. We came here craving Thai food and it had pretty good reviews. I guess if you like plain Thai food this is the place to go. But I love Thai because of its amazing flavored. I got the yellow curry. It wasn't gross, it was just alright. It tastes like something my mom could make. My boyfriend got the spicy crispy fish, he thought it was okay.  I thought it was too salty and tasted really fishy like the fish had been sitting in the fridge for a while. 
We got the sampler appetizer. The egg rolls were tiny but pretty good. The chicken satay tastes like yellow curry and peanut sauce and the fried stuffed chicken was really weird. My boyfriend wouldn't even eat it after the first bite. The soup and the beginning was weird too. It reminded me of swimming pool water haha

The waiter was really nice but the service took a life time. We were there for over an hour. Waiting 20 minutes just for them to take our credit card. Eventually my boyfriend just went to the window and paid. 

Like I said its not terrible but I probably wouldn't eat there again. If I do for some reason I'd try the pad Thai next time. 

Super cheap though so that's great. I guess.

excerpts: We also had this coconut-based soup, spring rolls, chicken satay, and fried banana with coconut ice cream.
So yum.
I will be back when I'm craving Thai again!
chicken satay.author: Stephanie G.
chicken satay.review: This place is a fairly small, family-owned restaurant. Our server was very friendly and I thought their food was pretty good.  I really liked that you could make your entree a combo by paying only $5.99 more! The combo includes soup, an appetizer, and dessert; such a good deal! i ordered the pad see ew and my boyfriend ordered a seafood curry dish (forgot what it's called). We also had this coconut-based soup, spring rolls, chicken satay, and fried banana with coconut ice cream. So yum. I will be back when I'm craving Thai again!

excerpts: Chicken Satay Skewers-

Tasted like they were microwaved
Pad See

Ew- Discolored, bland, with weeks old broccoli
Spicy Angel Chicken Wings-
chicken satay.author: jeff c.
chicken satay.review:
Are you serious!? How is this place even averaging four stars? I must have come in on an off day or something because this was one of the worst Thai joints I've ever dined at.

A few friends and I came here for lunch a few days ago. I was pretty excited to try the place out because I used to eat at a Lanna Thai out in Oklahoma when I lived there for a little bit. Thai food in the Midwest? Yeah I know...I was blown away too because it was the best Thai I've ever had. I was hoping that by some small chance this Noriega one was part of a huge chain. Let me tell you...shit didn't even come close.

Here's what we ordered:

Pad Thai- Strangely discolored, and painfully bland
Chicken Satay Skewers- Tasted like they were microwaved
Pad See Ew- Discolored, bland, with weeks old broccoli
Spicy Angel Chicken Wings- Only thing that could pass as edible
Lanna Fried Rice- Supposedly their specialty, but once again was dreadfully bland, overcooked, and looked like cafeteria food.

I would have given this place a one star, but the fact they had video Keno to keep me entertained bumped it up to two. If you're looking for bargain Thai in the Sunset, do King of Thai--it's quick and decent. If you're in the mood for something a little more high end, drop on by Marnee Thai. Whatever you do, though, I'd advise you to stay away from this place.

excerpts: :) whenever I come here I always order the chicken Satay, spicy angle wings
( it's spicy and the sauce is really really good)
the soup with the coconut is really good too because u can actually taste the coconut inside (sorry don't remember the name).
Overall the food is really good.
I come here often because the service is outstanding, always very nice and friendly
chicken satay.author: Phuong N.
chicken satay.review: This is so far one of the best Thai restaurant in sf :) whenever I come here I always order the chicken Satay, spicy angle wings ( it's spicy and the sauce is really really good) the soup with the coconut is really good too because u can actually taste the coconut inside (sorry don't remember the name). Overall the food is really good. I come here often because the service is outstanding, always very nice and friendly :)

well, if it weren't for a sense of what's right, I would probably eat 4-5 of them at one sitting.
chicken satay.author: Arthur C.
chicken satay.review: This was the first place I ever tried Thai food, so it set the standards for me. The chicken satay with peanut sauce is the best I've ever tasted, and the custard dessert.... well, if it weren't for a sense of what's right, I would probably eat 4-5 of them at one sitting.

excerpts: Pad Thai (covered in prawns, a delight), Chicken Satay (mmmm), rolls (double mmmm) and Lanna Fried Rice (their specialty).
Although I have not eaten at the restaurant, I can say they had been courteous and prompt with our order.
I would recommend going there for dinner.
chicken satay.author: Valerie V.
chicken satay.review: We had Lanna Thai cater a birthday party. The food was good. Pad Thai (covered in prawns, a delight), Chicken Satay (mmmm), rolls (double mmmm) and Lanna Fried Rice (their specialty). Although I have not eaten at the restaurant, I can say they had been courteous and prompt with our order. I would recommend going there for dinner.

some house soup cabbage msg water.

house soup.review:
Microwave beeping in the kitchen. Beep beep beep red flags 
One of the worst Thai food I have ever tasted.
Lacked flavor , authenticity , skill.

Local mom and pop shop. Nice decor and good service. Guy takes orders lady cooks in the back. Since 1988 but place was empty when I arrived and how you manage to stay open for so long with the type of product you provide 

some house soup cabbage msg water. 
Nothing special and the soup water tastes funny4/10 

Fish cake 6 small ass pieces cut in half with sweet dipping sauce 7/10. Had some ok flavor but the portion is way to skimp.

Pad thai worst I have ever had in the city. Skimp portion meat and tofu looked so skimp. 3/10
Hollywood Thai pad Thai where are you in SF? 

I had high hopes but when you tried good Thai food in LA this place can't compare/compete. Save yourself the trouble and money and stay away from the food here. 
Overall the food sucks! The service is good but who goes for service unless you want to :)

excerpts: Even though she couldn't drink the house soup (chicken broth!), we got pad see ew and pad thai vegetarian dishes, as well as the coconut soup and a vegetarian curry.
All were quite delicious and I got the stuffed chicken wings to satisfy my carnivorous side
house soup.author: Kris Q.
house soup.review:
STILL one of my favorite Thai joints in the city. It's a lovely couple owned and operated business and, after a trip down to Anaheim, one of the reasons I love living in the city -- for delicious, unique food made by pleasant people.

Came here with a foreign friend that was allergic to dairy as well as a vegetarian. Didn't realize just how many vegetarian options Lanna has to offer. Even though she couldn't drink the house soup (chicken broth!), we got pad see ew and pad thai vegetarian dishes, as well as the coconut soup and a vegetarian curry. All were quite delicious and I got the stuffed chicken wings to satisfy my carnivorous side :).

You really can't go wrong with Lanna's specialty, stuffed chicken wings. I just need to emphasize just HOW good they are, plus you can have them almost every day of the week paired with a curry or noodle through the daily lunch specials.

As like most Thai joints, lunches are relatively cheap and dinners are considerably pricier. Lanna is like this, but like GOOD Thai joints, completely worth it. The menu has something for everyone from classic dishes to more unique ones that you WON'T be able to find just anywhere.

Service is usually very good unless there's a surge of customers. The food is consistently delicious. And best of all, the restaurant is VERY clean (look at those scorecards!!). Bonus: I love drinking the water out of the wine glasses like I'm a huge deal. Score!

Parking: Noriega isn't as horrible as Irving but not as good as Taraval. When I go for lunch, I try to parking across 19th avenue near the more residential side (no meters). Beware of street cleaning!

excerpts:
:
i get the daily special:  starting with their tom kah kai soup (chicken, lemongrass coconut soup -- instead of the house soup, add $1),  bbq chicken w/side of sweet chili sauce, pad thai & rice.
deilish, perfect combination -- all
compliment each other well.........
bbq chicke is very tasty.
note, not your typical pad thai -- noodles aren't flat & are thinner, does taste different -- but
hub starts with the tom kah kai soup (instead of the house soup, add $1), then he either gets the beef brochette (charcoal broiled)
w/ sauce & veggie on the side & an order of rice OR
house soup.author: Cindi N.
house soup.review:
stars are for the consistently good food, friendly service & reliability (explained below).

have been coming here for years!  this is a family owned (husband & wife) restaurant.  has a nice, cozy, homey feel -- just eat, no scene restaurant, .   we're always welcomed by the husband's friendly service.  once in a great while we get to say "hi" to the wife, when she's not busy cooking in the kitchen.  nice "reliable" restaurant in the sense that, if we're starving & we want to eat now, we know we don't have to wait to be seated, tables are readily available.  or we go here if we don't want to get dressed up & deal with the scene, cause there's absolutely no scene here....and we know what we're getting, our usual -- which is consistently good.

our usual:
i get the daily special:  starting with their tom kah kai soup (chicken, lemongrass coconut soup -- instead of the house soup, add $1),  bbq chicken w/side of sweet chili sauce, pad thai & rice.  deilish, perfect combination -- all compliment each other well.........bbq chicke is very tasty.  note, not your typical pad thai -- noodles aren't flat & are thinner, does taste different -- but i like it & appreciate that lanna has its own flavor..........

hub starts with the tom kah kai soup (instead of the house soup, add $1), then he either gets the beef brochette (charcoal broiled) w/ sauce & veggie on the side & an order of rice OR  the lanna brochette which is the same beef brochette with charcoal broiled prawns.  delish too!   

occassionally we've ordered:
- deep-fried calamari tossed w/ garlic, salt & pepper, carrot, red onion, cilantro & green onion........one of our favorite deep-fried calamari, tasty, spicy, a bit on the salty side.....
- thai iced tea -- nothing special

we've had the special with  pad thai w/ one of the following curries: mussamun curry or thai yellow curry (good, but nothing special) or panang curry..........i remember i thought they all tasted good.........but the past 8 - 10 years i've stuck to the usual & happy with that............i  go there specifically cause i'm craving the usual.......

i'll have to agree w/ the other reviews -- they do have one of the best peanut sauce.  used to buy a jar of peanut sauce to take home & dip bbq chicken or add to a bbq chicken sandwich (asian/thai style).

excerpts: banana fritter
, I can't eat like I use to but this was really the best part for the end of the meal.
Crispy crunch outside, soft inside.
Love it with coconut ice cream
banana fritter.author: Myron L.
banana fritter.review:
I've been here coming here for years. I swear the food has never changed. I can't say what is authentic but Paul and his wife makes it as authentic as I think it can be to me. Every other Thai restaurant Just doesn't cut it for me compared to lanna's.

- Thai ice tea, can't go wrong or maybe I just like the one here more 

-Tom kah Kai aka coconut soup is my favorite soup here. The lemony scent and slight sourness with the aromatic coconut flavor just makes me want some now talking about it. What can I say. This soup got some of my favorite flavors in there and they make it good.

- appetizers . I don't think I've gone wrong with any of the apps here. the appetizer sampler is great for 2 people to try a few things

- stuffed chicken wings is fried, soft, and it's just good. they actually use to stuff the filling between the bones but that was 10-15 years ago?

- lanna fried rice, the rice with everything in it and it's really good. Pineapples, tomatoes, dried pork shreds, raisins, chicken, shrimp. The seasoning is yum

- Kai yang, the bbq chicken isn't always available but it's a great deal for the quantity, flavor, and price

-fried banana fritter , I can't eat like I use to but this was really the best part for the end of the meal. Crispy crunch outside, soft inside. Love it with coconut ice cream

I will probably be back, since it's the only thai place in my hood.

I got the tom kha soup with tofu and it was pretty good. It had a lot of lemongrass, which i like, but not enough coconut milk. There were a lot of veggies in the soup though, so that made up for it. The banana fritter and coconut ice cream were very delicious! I will probably be back, since it's the only thai place in my hood.

fried banana with coconut ice cream.author: Corinna T.
fried banana with coconut ice cream.review: Try this place out!! I was pleasantly surprised at the tastiness of the food here for under $7! Daily lunch specials M-F cost only $6.95, are filling, and the whole menu ranges around the same price too. Today my friends and I all ordered the daily special and we all loved it: pad thai with rice and bbq chicken. For dessert, we shared the fried banana with coconut ice cream, and savored it to the last bite. The environment is pretty ornate and there's lots of seating. Service was great and our waiter was funny. I will be back!

excerpts: The $2.75 Flan was delicious enough, but the standout was the $3.75 Fried Banana with Coconut Ice Cream.
Fried with a crunchy crust and a nice contrast to the bracing coconut flavor of the ice cream (see photos).
fried banana with coconut ice cream.author: Ed U.
fried banana with coconut ice cream.review:
Lanna is not a place I would have found on my own. San Francisco is not one city but a cluster of culinary micro-climates like the heavily Asian fog bank that makes up this stretch of Noriega in the Outer Sunset. My massage therapist (yes, I have one...sometimes...don't judge me!) recommended it to me a while ago, and he looks like a very healthy eater with a penchant for spicy Southeast Asian by way of his Malaysian-bred wife. So I convinced Jamie W. to make the trek with me to try it on an evening where we felt the need to try something healthy. We didn't accomplish "healthy", but we managed to have some surprisingly good eats for the drive. 

We started with a hearty $6.95 bowl of Tohm Kah, the coconut milk soup with chicken, mushroom, baby corns, green onion, lemongrass and lemon juice (see photo). Perfect starter on a cold night. The $6.25 order of Chicken Satay came with a couple of skewers marinated in curry paste and accompanied by the all-critical peanut sauce with a nice consistency (see photo). Entrees were solid. We went even more predictable with the $7.25 Pad Kee Mao, which offered the thick chow fun noodles mixed with chicken, broccoli and bok choy (see photo). 

Jamie went back to his Kentucky roots when he was drawn to the $8.50 Barbecue Chicken, which came with four big pieces slathered with a sweet curry sauce that wasn't too overwhelming (see photo). It didn't seem like a particularly Thai dish but who cares. We should have been sated, but we decided to try the desserts since we made room. The $2.75 Flan was delicious enough, but the standout was the $3.75 Fried Banana with Coconut Ice Cream. Fried with a crunchy crust and a nice contrast to the bracing coconut flavor of the ice cream (see photos). Definitely worth a trip out to the far reaches of the Sunset for us downtown types. 

FOOD - 4 stars...excellent Thai dishes, well priced 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...compact place, could do without the lotto boards 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...good though attention wavers when big parties come in 
TOTAL - 4 stars...barbecue chicken and fried bananas almost give this Thai place a country twang

excerpts: We also had this coconut-based soup, spring rolls, chicken satay, and fried banana with coconut ice cream.
So yum.
I will be back when I'm craving Thai again!
fried banana with coconut ice cream.author: Stephanie G.
fried banana with coconut ice cream.review: This place is a fairly small, family-owned restaurant. Our server was very friendly and I thought their food was pretty good.  I really liked that you could make your entree a combo by paying only $5.99 more! The combo includes soup, an appetizer, and dessert; such a good deal! i ordered the pad see ew and my boyfriend ordered a seafood curry dish (forgot what it's called). We also had this coconut-based soup, spring rolls, chicken satay, and fried banana with coconut ice cream. So yum. I will be back when I'm craving Thai again!

excerpts: The pad thai and egg rolls were both bomb and the fried ice cream for desert left me so full, but in the best possible way.
fried ice cream.author: Olympia Z.
fried ice cream.review: This place was awesome. Very nice homey feeling. The pad thai and egg rolls were both bomb and the fried ice cream for desert left me so full, but in the best possible way. :)

excerpts: FRIED ICE CREAM!!
fried ice cream.author: Gillian Y.
fried ice cream.review:
My husband and I come here very often. The owners are from Chiang Mai and have been in business for many years. The wife cooks and her husband serves. Very homey and feels like you are visiting family. I really like the Pad Thai because i don't like the very sweet or oily renditions elsewhere. The Basil Fish is really yummy too. My husband likes to get the daily special (usually Pad Thai, rice and different types of curry depending in the day, sometimes include their stuffed chicken wings). Oh! FRIED ICE CREAM!!! need i say more. 

It is a little quiet but I personally like it without the rush and wait!

excerpts: Fried ice cream!
Probably the best I've ever had.
Honey over a crispy doughy shell over ice cream.... can't ask for more *drool*
fried ice cream.author: S. D.
fried ice cream.review: Great neighborhood eat!  I love this wife and husband duo.  They're always in the mood for conversation if you want, and the food is not bad.  Nothing fancy but definitely still worth your while.  My favorite thing on the menu? Fried ice cream! Probably the best I've ever had.  Honey over a crispy doughy shell over ice cream.... can't ask for more *drool*

$3 and enough to share with someone.

excerpts: I also had the fried ice cream for dessert which was awesome as well.
The gentleman who waited on us was so sweet and cute.
:) will def be going back!
fried ice cream.author: Tara T.
fried ice cream.review: My friend and I found this place on a whim. It was incredible! The calamari was the best I have ever had with an amazing blend of spices. I also had the fried ice cream for dessert which was awesome as well. The gentleman who waited on us was so sweet and cute. :) will def be going back!

excerpts: - they got fried ice cream!
fried ice cream.author: Karin L.
fried ice cream.review:
- nice small quiet place. great place to chat. 

- lots of Thai decorations on the walls, lots of mirrors

- we were the only customer. went around 12:40pm.

- there was no one around..stood around a while.. until the waiter came out from the restroom.

- we get to choose where to sit.

- they got a decent menu~ dish price range around $5 up.

- they got fried ice cream! which my friend was interest in.. but 
complained it was kinda of too sweet as honey was added to it.

- we had to wait a bit for the food, as i believe only one person was cooking it~ maybe the wife?

- the service was great~ maybe because we were the only ones.. he refilled our water without asking~~ as we got curry rice.

- friend also complained that they gave small portions. so if you like to big portions..this is not the place~ unless you either order more, or go get more food outside of this restaurant.

- oh yeah. before our dishes came, we were given a small bowl of soup~ I'm not sure if this was included in our order or not. But the soup was pretty good. Very Fresh aftertaste. haha or maybe i was just thirsty

- 3 people = around $30.  3 dishes, 2 drinks, and a dessert.

-overall, this place is great, food is okay~ normal. not very great, but not very poor...it's right in the middle. Feels like I'm eating a home dinner or the sort.  if you like Thai food. this is the place. =)
